question_content.barrons:question: All of the following are weaknesses of the above argument EXCEPT that

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: it makes generalizations concerning the status of women in general based on the plight of a single group of women
it draws conclusions from statistical evidence that the data may not support
it disregards efforts being made by some employers to end job discrimination within their own firms
it fails to fully consider possible remedies other than the one proposed
it ignores other possible explanations for the cited difference in average salaries

question_content.barrons:explanation:
it disregards efforts being made by some employers to end job discrimination within their own firms

The fact that some employers do not discriminate against women does not undermine the argument as presented, because it does not imply that no problem of discrimination exists. Therefore, it is not a weakness of the argument.

It makes generalizations concerning the status of women in general based on the plight of a single group of women is incorrect. The argument bases its generalizations about women on the status of the group of female executives. This is a weakness of the argument.

It draws conclusions from statistical evidence that the data may not support is incorrect. The argument draws possibly unwarranted conclusions from the women executivesâ€™ salary statistics. This is a weakness of the argument.

It fails to fully consider possible remedies other than the one proposed is incorrect. The argument offers only one remedy: an Equal Rights Amendment. This is a weakness of the argument.

It ignores other possible explanations for the cited differences in average salaries is incorrect. The argument never suggests any other possible explanation for the salary difference. This is a weakness of the argument.
